Share: Digg Facebook StumbleUpon Part 2: More Mysterious Multi-Colored Aerial Light Patterns Over Reno, Nevada, and Now Over Empire, Ohio © 2009 by Linda Moulton Howe “I noticed there was a circular-shaped object at 2:41 AM Eastern, and it was just directly west of the power plant. ...it went super fast and zipped to where I was at. And I thought, ‘It’s like this thing knows my every move.’” – S arah, Security Guard, Empire, Ohio, January 3, 2009 C ropped digital image taken at 7:22 PM Eastern, January 3, 2009, Empire, Ohio. Image © 2009 by Robert Maxwell. R eturn to Part 1 January 29, 2009 Empire, Ohio - Between Christmas 2008 and the first week of January 2009, Penny saw the sparkling object projecting colorful patterns in the sky south of her Reno, Nevada, home again and she is going to try more photographing. During those same days and nights a long way to the east in Empire, Ohio, at the Sammis Coal Power Plant on the Ohio River, is the security guard I call Sarah. I interviewed her about the triangle craft and glowing pod that she saw there on October 23, 2008. Since then, Sarah has seen many more and different strange, aerial objects in the sky. Some are disc-like craft that project colors and make patterns like those photographed by Penny Rubsam in Reno. Sarah tried to photograph one odd, sparkling craft and it dimmed every time she raised her camera as if conscious Sarah is there trying to photograph. Recently on the night of December 27, 2008, Sarah made a note in her log that at 1:05 AM while she was working security with another guard, the two noticed a bright light in the sky west of the Sammis plant. Interview: Sarah, Security Guard, Empire and Stratton, Ohio: “I stopped the truck and got out and was looking at it. It was a circular-shaped object with the rotating green and blue and white and red lights on it. And it just kind of set there and we watched it there for probably ten to twelve minutes. And then at 1:57 AM Eastern (December 27, 2008), I spotted a circular object with the rotating lights. It was a little bit east of our Tronto plant and it was over a little town in West Virginia called New Cumberland. And we sat there and watched it for probably another ten minutes. Then at 2:29 AM that same night at the north yard of our power plant – it’s real dark up there. There’s almost no lights whatsoever. And we noticed one circular object that was just west of where we were, like northwest of the Sammis power plant. And I tried to get a photograph of it and every time I would put the camera out to take a picture, the circular object would fade out. I would put the camera away and the object would get real bright again. I’d bring the camera out and it would fade away. I even tried just barely moving the

camera down and as soon as I would move the camera down, the object would appear bright. But as soon as I would go to snap that picture, it would dim down again. We watched it there for probably twenty minutes to a half hour and all that time I tried to get a picture of this object and it was like the object knew I was trying to get a picture of it. ALMOST LIKE A CAT AND MOUSE GAME? Ye s . IN OTHER WORDS, IF I GET THE PICTURE, YOU WOULD RAISE YOUR CAMERA AT SOMETHING THAT WAS BRIGHT IN THE SKY AND INSTANTLY IT WOULD DIM? Ye s . AND YOU GOT THE DISTINCT IMPRESSION THAT WHATEVER THE OBJECT WAS IN THE SKY WAS AWARE OF YOU TRYING TO TAKE PHOTOGRAPHS. Oh, yes, it seemed like it was definitely aware that I was trying to take photographs of it. WHEN YOU THINK ABOUT THAT, WHAT KIND OF RESIDUE ARE YOU LEFT WITH THAT WHATEVER IS IN THESE LIGHTS IS CONSCIOUS OF YOU TRYING TO PHOTOGRAPH IT? It makes me a little nervous. I mean, I’m not afraid of it or anything. It just makes me a little nervous because it’s not the only incident where it wasn’t just that I was trying to take a photograph of it, but one night it was actually following me. January 3, 2009 - Light Pace 's Sarah's Security Car PACING YOU IN YOUR SECURITY CAR? Ye s . WHAT HAPPENED THEN? That night there, that was on January 3, 2009. I noticed there was a circular-shaped object at 2:41 AM Eastern, and it was just directly west of the power plant. I watched it there for a few minutes until it was 2:47 AM. Then I thought I would go further north where it’s darker to see if I could get a better photograph of it. And I went about one-quarter to one-half mile further north and after a few seconds of me stopping there, the object left where it was at and came to where I was at. So I sat there and watched it for probably until almost 3:05 AM. Then I thought I would go even further north to where there are no lights. So I left there and went further north and when I got there, it was like 3:07 AM. I looked back and the object was where I had just been at and within a few seconds, you could just see it. I mean, it went super fast and zipped to where I was at. And I thought, ‘It’s like this thing knows my every move.’ Then I thought, ‘I’m going to go south.’ So, I turned back south about three-quarters of a mile to a mile. I stopped there and within a few seconds, it zipped to right where I was at. I watched it there until around 3:25 AM, and then it moved and went directly over the Sammis power plant and it stayed over the top of the power plant until like 3:37 AM. Then once it did that, it shot straight up into the sky.” January 3, 2009 Between 7:15 PM and 8 PM Round Aerial Object Changes Patterns Earlier in the evening before Sarah was paced by the circular, aerial object, a resident who lives right on the edge of the Sammis Coal Power Plant between Empire and Stratton, Ohio, also became nervous when a round light in the sky began pulsing different colors and patterns. Robert Maxwell got his small digital camera and managed to get several images, which he noted were “between 7:15 PM and 8 PM Eastern” and some had times noted.
